meanings.definition: Having more feathers or plumage than a young bird.
meanings.sent1: The fledgier robin had bright feathers.
meanings.sent2: The fledgier chicks were ready to fly.
meanings.sent3: The fledgier sparrow showed off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent4: The fledgier cardinal stood out among the other birds.
meanings.sent5: The fledgier peacock displayed its majestic plumage.

meanings.definition: More experienced or skilled than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was the fledgier player on the team.
meanings.sent2: The fledgier chef cooked with precision.
meanings.sent3: The fledgier dancer wowed the audience with her moves.
meanings.sent4: The fledgier artist painted a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The fledgier musician played the piano beautifully.
